reviews.text: In our recent development discussion, the team addressed the need for a unified deployment pipeline capable of supporting microservices across both AWS and GCP.
reviews.reason_text: Discussing team needs for a unified deployment pipeline.

reviews.text: This need arises from our goal to ensure multi-cloud compatibility, reduce infrastructure fragmentation, and streamline our CI/CD processes.
reviews.reason_text: Explaining reasons behind multi-cloud compatibility goals.
Stating that two options were evaluated without action.

reviews.text: Option A proposed using managed Kubernetes services (EKS on AWS and GKE on GCP) in combination with ArgoCD for GitOps-style deployment.
reviews.reason_text: Describing an option without enforcing actions.

reviews.text: Option B considered adopting Acme Orchestrator, a proprietary orchestration platform offering simplified deployment workflows but with limited community support and potential vendor lock-in.
reviews.reason_text: Decision to proceed with Option A was made.

reviews.text: After careful consideration, we decided to proceed with Option A.
The choice was driven by the advantages of open standards, strong community support, lower long-term costs, and existing team familiarity with Kubernetes and Helm.

Although ArgoCD introduces a steeper learning curve and configuring multi-cluster IAM will require some effort, the benefits of standardized, portable infrastructure across providers outweigh the challenges.
reviews.reason_text: Explaining the context behind ArgoCD's steeper learning curve.

reviews.text: The next steps involve building a proof-of-concept deployment in AWS’s us-east-1 and GCP’s europe-west-1 regions.
reviews.reason_text: Describing steps for building a proof-of-concept deployment.

reviews.text: We'll also update our Terraform modules to reflect this architecture and set a milestone review for May 30, 2025.
reviews.reason_text: Describing future actions without enforceable behavior.

reviews.text: This decision positions us well for scalable, cloud-agnostic deployments moving forward.
reviews.reason_text: Explaining future scalability and cloud-agnostic deployments.
